website_summaries.verdict: A paired down instant film camera that's perfect for the spontaneous traveler and photographer.
pros: This little camera is lightweight and compact
Pictures taken with this inexpensive mini cam turn out consistently well
Auto flash and auto exposure help to make picture taking a simple art
cons: You can't mount this model on a tripod

customer_reviews.title: My kids love their mini polaroid cameras but do not buy one ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids love their mini polaroid cameras but do not buy one unless you are prepared to set up a chore list for them to earn their own film!! The film is SO expensive and with all the modern technology, I really had to help them understand that you cannot just snap 10 photos of the same scene to assure ONE good picture. Each picture is 75% to $1.00 so it taught them to really slow down when capturing moments. These cameras also don't take great photos unless the lighting is perfect. Not good if the sun is out and not good in darker rooms. Overall though, they've had fun with them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Soooooo cute. I bought it for my daughter's 14th birthday and it's exactly what I remember those old cameras being. It's fun and she loves it. It's easy to use and adds a quirky quality to the photos. If you have any melanin, you'll need to be close up with flash or in great lighting. My kid and neice are almost washed out due to their brown coloring but we still enjoy the camera and am happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gilder

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing the camera for my trip to Europe it didn't work. Once we were there I tried two different roles of film, the first picture would come out perfect then after that it would turn completely black. We tried multiple different ways to get it to work and nothing did. Extremely disappointed. Not only do I not have pictures from the trip like I had wanted, but I wasted money on both the camera and two roles of film.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: The film for this isn't cheap to make it even better we have went through 2 packs of film hoping ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to update my review... You can see pictures below.. Okay I took matters into my own hands I took the camera apart due to the fact it was too late to return. The problem was there was a piece of black tape of some sort stuck to the the rollers where the film comes out and I have fixed the problem and the pictures print perfect now. However I am giving it a 3 star because I had to fix the problem myself plus go through 2 sets of film. Hope this helps anyone with a similar problem
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: People took pictures and hung/clipped them to the lighted string which made for a great social activity at an event where you ha
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a hit at my sister's engagement party. Instead of a photo booth with silly props, I brought back the 90s with this FujiFilm and bought these clothes pin string lights that Amazon also sells. People took pictures and hung/clipped them to the lighted string which made for a great social activity at an event where you have all sorts of people from your life who don't know each other gather in one place :) just wish this had a memory card, but I won't take a star away for something it never said it had.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: xx
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this. However, I later discovered there's a "selfie" attachment out there for purchase. So I could've saved money and not gotten a 9 since that selfie mirror is the only difference from the other minis. I bought a mini 8 case and the mini 9 fit it perfectly, just in case others were wondering!
customer_reviews.author: NJG

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun product! It's great for events and DIY photobooths
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun product! It's great for events and DIY photobooths. The photos come out great. The best quality I find is outside in natural lighting, though.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: This camera is known for film jamming in output!  Read reviews before purchase .
customer_reviews.text: Not a great product. My daughter saved her allowance and purchased this camera. It has been used a total of 4xs and the film gets stuck in the output. The second time it was used this happened. Read a troubleshooting website that had inquiries for same problem. We wasted a pack of film trying to unjam photo in output and problem seemed to be resolved. Camera seemed to work fine the third time. Just tried to use camera and will not even work - seems to be jammed in output.....again. She is so upset as we are disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this camera! I decided I wanted to do a photo journal and wanted instant prints for the book. It took a couple photos to figure out the settings but I think I have it for the most part. The picture quality is fantastic when I do it correctly and the fact that it prints instantly is on the best. After I received mine I went and bought another for my daughter. I wouldn't recommend this to children under 9, they tend to open the back of the camera and expose the film. My daughter was great with it, her brother however now have to replace some film.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The camera quality makes you feel like you're in the 90s
customer_reviews.text: The camera quality makes you feel like you're in the 90s, it's great as long as you're not expecting crystal clear, see everyone type's of pore pictures. Great for when you chill with friends, and perfect for scrapbooking.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Got unlucky. We got a defective 🍋 lemon
customer_reviews.text: I was giving this as a gift 🎁. So it took a few weeks before the recipient opened it but to everyone’s disappointment it was defective. The chipd was so heart broken and I could not return it to amazon so they are trying to see if the local fuji can fix it as it is less than 45d from pruchase. I’m not sure if we just got unlucky but hopefully fuji over there could fix it.
customer_reviews.author: OmedetoU GozaimasU

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but over/under develops film every time
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but terrible camera. It either over or under develops. As a photographer, I was thoroughly disappointed to see the results when I finally used this. I have tried every setting in different lights. Nothing improved. You have to have very specific amount of light to get an okay development. Forget taking any pictures with the sun in it. It just develops as a black ball. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First photo worked, stopped working after first use
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Extremely frustrating to see your 9 year old get a camera for Christmas that’s doesn’t work. The film is very expensive and all but one turned out. After reading about the camera, this seems to be an issue. The first photo turns out (first use) then it stops working properly. This camera is also stuck on one setting. Yes, I did all the troubleshooting and changed the batteries and tried a different film pack. The camera is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Heggie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t work
customer_reviews.text: Ok so took on vacation for nine year old bought eight rolls of Fugi film sadly only every fourth picture developed?? Rest turned out black. Can’t return got back from vacation and we r out three days.
customer_reviews.author: kim fitch

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great quality photos!
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! We bought two cameras for our wedding as a guest book idea. Took a couple pictures as soon as we got them in the mail and we're totally in love! Growing up with Polaroids as our primary source of photography ( that or going to JCPenney for family portraits) my husband and I both were sent back a few years. The quality of the pictures are better than expected, the camera is super easy to use and we are looking forward to not only using it at our wedding but for future pictures to capture our special moments in a "vintage" sort of way. Definitely would recommend this camera to anyone and everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Krista PRuske

customer_reviews.title: Amazing in every way!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this polaroid. The color is so beautiful and soft (was true to picture). I am beyond pleased with this camera!!
customer_reviews.author: Village Idiot

customer_reviews.title: Cannot find the right lighting to make pictures look decent
customer_reviews.text: I’m struggling with this camera. I am from the Polaroid generation. I thought this would be fantastic for my 6.5 year old son to capture our European vacation. Before we even left we tested the camera, watched a you tube tutorial, took a few pictures, followed the cameras lighting indicator....it just doesn’t take “great” pictures. Our pictures from the Eiffel Tower were all throw always. Lighting was so off pictures came out almost white. Followed the camera to the exact prompt and just terrible pictures. Very expensive film to just throw away. If anyone has any tips please let me know. Way too expensive to be a “disposable” camera.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Gootsie

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful way to create memories.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this camera! I used it for Thanksgiving and everyone got a good kick out of it! Many commented they are so glad that they are back into style and love the photos! The film is easy to store, but it does take practice adjusting on how to take it. (It doesn't have a zoom so therefore you have to move in to become the zoom) I will continue to use this baby from here on out!
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Lou

customer_reviews.title: it's not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is not like the Polaroids we grew up with. The pictures are like 1"x2". so super small. and very pricey too. Kids love it, but once again, very pricey for the film. I was NOT given a discount for a review on this product. My review is real and honest. Please help me by liking my review. It will move my review closer to the top for fellow shoppers to read a real review.
customer_reviews.author: km in tx

customer_reviews.title: The hit gift this year for Christmas 2017.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on a whim for our 8 and 10 year old daughters to share. The good news...I was right both girls loved this camera and took tons of creative photos for Christmas. It was really fun to watch the film magically develop before our eyes. This camera also is waaaaaay better than the Polaroids of my youth. The bad news...a few arguments broke out over sharing. I broke down and bought a 2nd camera to resolve the fights. Yup...totally caved. But glad the girls loved this gift so much. The photo shows a rainbow strap. I bought that separately.
customer_reviews.author: K. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: See your snaps in just about a minute!
customer_reviews.text: Teach kids how to budget their prescious few shots! Hah, they will blow right through all their film. Well, it is a life lesson for them, and they have fun too. Camera works at least as well as the origunal polaroids did, that is, it will jam ocasionally. Just open it up, and pull out the jammed one, which will expose the next film. Snap that one, and continue shooting. Ahh, that nostalgic feeling of getting to see your pics in just a minute or so. Ok, i'm bumping it back to 5 stars just for that. Buy it, just be prepared to buy lots of film. Note, the pictures are much smaller than the original polaroids.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: Loveeee the color matches my room. The quality is marvelous. It comes with a strap and close up lens which makes taking pictures easier. My cousin loved it too and bought one ! So I totally recommend! :)
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Not Actually "Cobalt" Blue
customer_reviews.text: Camera functions as advertised and I like it functionally. It's fun. The main issue is that the pictures show a richer, deeper cobalt blue, but the actual camera I received is slightly lighter and more of a dusty/periwinkle blue. Yes, I looked at it on different devices. "Cobalt" blue is what it is shown on the pictures, it's just not what the camera actually is. When you're selling cameras of different colors to capture consumers' attention, the photos should match the item.
customer_reviews.author: DolphinBlue

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camera For Anything
customer_reviews.text: This camera is the BEST thing that i have gotten on amazon. It came perfect with no defects, no problems. Works beautifully! I also purchased a case with it and a 60 pack of film. All of it was PERFECT. I will add a photo below
customer_reviews.author: Ruth A.

customer_reviews.title: One fetal flaw
customer_reviews.text: An extremely fun throwback to the original Polaroid cameras. A great design that combines the instant satisfaction we are used to with digital cameras with a simple but functional usability. The camera is fairly priced as well as the film. Photo quality is stingingly similar to the original poloroids even mimicking the brownish vintage look. Unfortunately this is the second camera I got, the first one was defective and I had to return it. It suffered from what I have come to find out is a fairly common defect, the shutter sticks resulting in more than half the photos taken to come out black. Luckily, the replacement I ordered has worked flawlessly for months and produced between 75-100 photos.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Awful purchase
customer_reviews.text: I would not have wasted nearly $100 on this cheap camera and accessories if I knew 1.) how small the pictures were 2.) how horrible the picture quality was, I can barely see anybody in the pictures I’ve taken because the shot quality is so bad. Or too bright or too dark. I’ve had my eye on this lil camera for almost 2 years before saving the money to purchase, and I am horribly disappointed in the product. Don’t waste your money. Use the CVS photo app instead
customer_reviews.author: briana

customer_reviews.title: Lots of  films wasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my nephew! And it was the biggest christmas fail! We tried different Ligth exposures and we got the same result! I don’t get it and we already spent 3 film packages! (inside and outside tries). This camera s*cks!. A waste of money! I want to give negative stars to this review!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Pure junk.
customer_reviews.text: No. No. No. This is truly a piece of junk. The picture quality is garbage. The camera is clunky and a takes horribly inconsistent pictures. You can take two exact pictures in the exact same setting and one will be dark brown all over (way to dark) and the other somewhat towards ok. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera from directly from Fujifilm on Amazon, and I bought Fujifilm official films from target and NONE of the pictures I took developed. The films have an expiration date of August 2021, so that shouldn't be a problem, and I followed every instruction explicitly when setting the camera up the first time. This was supposed to be a birthday present, and because it did not work I could not take pictures with my family. What a shame. I expect Fujifilm to provide me with a new camera and new film to make up for this terrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ofrat Gilady-Sten

customer_reviews.title: So far I love the actual camera
customer_reviews.text: So far I love the actual camera, its fun and gave me so much nostalgia! My only complaint is that the instruction and product data sheets say it comes with a hand strap and mine did not have one. It seems as if the package was tampered with and it honestly worries me because I don't want my camera to stop working because it might have been tampered with.
customer_reviews.author: bencosmek

customer_reviews.title: Cute camera
customer_reviews.text: Super cute and simple camera. I wanted these images for a baby book. The prints are small, about the size of a credit card. They turn out darling and you really can see the image well. I like that there is that small white space at the bottom of the photo that you can write a caption date. The camera is plastic, feels cheap, but really is darling and works well for whet I intended It for. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Martin

customer_reviews.title: CAMERA DOESN'T EVEN WORK
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail and haven't opened the mail since I've received it since I didn't have a chance to use it (I didn't have film at the moment). So, a few weeks back, I ordered film and tried out a few shots, but they all came back and had white spots. No image was formed, but the film worked on my friend's polaroid camera. They sent me a DEFECTIVE CAMERA, and it's so difficult to get in touch with them. I can't even return it because the window passed, and don't even know if I have warranty. This is so disappointing, this company fails me far too often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The first picture you take isn't a picture! Do not open the back of the camera!
customer_reviews.text: I made that mistake but after realizing how the camera functions, I love it. The quality is pretty good on most, not sure how the settings on it work there's outdoor indoor and other features but don't know if it automatically chooses one or what, because when I move the dial to a setting it doesn't always change to that setting?
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: cute works love it
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, works well. Love the green color! I'm glad to have gotten this online for like $25 less than what it costs at Target. When I bought it on Amazon it was $43 and took 3 days to arrive. You need a lot of light to take photos even if you use the Hi-Fi setting! I tried to take selfies indoors and every single time the photos came out completely black. Does the camera know I'm evil? But pictures with a lot of natural light come out ok. Outdoor photos during the daytime would probably look best. I like the look of these pictures. Very charming. I like to scrapbook so this is a great camera to have.
customer_reviews.author: sami

customer_reviews.title: This works great for my elderly father in law with alzheimer's
customer_reviews.text: Great to quickly capture a picture and have it in hand in minutes. It's not the greatest picture quality in the world, but the prints are decent and durable and develop in minutes. It's easy to use and load. We take pictures of his friends when they visit him, label and date them, and put them on a big corkboard in his room so he can see and remember who visited him recently.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun McClintock

customer_reviews.title: Cheap disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas After 3 pics of terrible quality photos the whole dang thing quit working, this is a cute camera with a great idea behind it, but I feel like if America can put a man on the moon, certainly they could figure out how to make a better quality camera in the year of 2019. I repurchased this at Target and it also quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: A good camera for vacations and road trips!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my vacations and it really is a good reliable insta camera. the pictures are on the smaller side (hence the mini) but they are cute photos and have a cool little vibe to them since they develop with a vintage style filter. They develop quick and the camera itself is durable and chic. The only con is that im not sure if i can ever turn the flash off? but either way its still a good camera!
customer_reviews.author: MarieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the gas I spent having to return this
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I didn't expect the picture quality to be anything near what you're used to with digital cameras, but this is worse than my old polaroid (and the film it takes is half the size!?). Changing the image settings for more/less exposure sometimes just results in pure black pictures, even when you're following the recommendation. Maybe it would be cool for kids, if it actually worked, but out of the 20 pictures we took, 11 of them were completely black.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Cute Colour & Camera !!
customer_reviews.text: Adorable Kids instant Camera ! I having been hesitating for a long while before I purchased - was looking at the Mini 8, but the Mini 9 came out and so far not disappointed ! Colour is adorable too! The plus is the mini mirror on the front, same loading etc like the mini 8. The only thing is that some of the mini 8 accessories don't work on the mini 9, the Lens for example - you can damage if forced the Lens from the mini 8 to go on - you see the shape of the Lens aren't the same - so be weary !
customer_reviews.author: Myra MLH

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased nicer, expensive and better version of camera (Fujifilm Instax Mini 90 Instant Film Camera (Brown)) as i always wanted instant film camera. These camera captures pics with different color setting. They are fun to use and great memory keeper. In cell phone age we take ton of pictures and rarely print them. I bought couple of this for nice price as gifts (for 35$ they are steal). I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: VIRAL PATEL

customer_reviews.title: What a messss!!
customer_reviews.text: Im so disappointed to the camera. I just used last weekend on our retreat for first time after purchasing a month ago. At first I thought it was the film issue and so reordered different pack from a different seller then took pictures again. Just 2 came out with dark background then started to blackout again with dots. I wasted over 3 packs of films and finally discovered it was the camera problem! Camera is a junk..
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY!!!!!  WARNING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if I could. 95% of the pictures don’t turn out. We thought it was the film, so we wasted time trying other films, and now it says the time has run out for the company to do anything. That’s BS! Don’t buy this camera off Amazon. At least if you buy it in an actual store you could go in and talk to someone. TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pollie

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: after about a month, a piece around the eye lens broke off and shortly thereafter the pictures started appearing with a line down the right side. my daughter (13 yrs old) contacted the manufacturer and they were pretty straight forward. they paid the postage to and from to send it in for repair, but said that the chipped piece indicated that it had been dropped and voided the warranty. overall, i'm very disappointed with the product, but not the customer service. individual film pieces also cost about .75 cents each and they're barely bigger than a passport photo.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Camera doesn't work; Fuji customer service is non-existant
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter and decided to keep it for a Christmas present. Big mistake - because when she opened it on Christmas, half the photos came out black. We have now figured out that the first photo every time you turn it on comes out black but the second one works. Not sure why... But we are outside of Amazon's 90-day return window and we have called FujiFilm FIVE TIMES and never spoke to a human. If the customer service gods are out there reading this, please help me! Otherwise, I have a 50/50 camera that I can't afford to buy more film for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Camera doesn’t work! Every time I turned it on it made a loud crunching noise and wouldn’t take the picture. I wasted a full pack of film trying to get it to work. I thought maybe it was a user error since I hadn’t had one of these cameras before. However, when I purchased a new one at my local craft store, that camera took pictures perfectly. I returned the one I bought here; definitely recommend buying this camera elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: K. B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if this one is just broken but as soon as I put the batteries in, it spit out all the film in the package without me taking any pictures, and wasted a whole pack of film.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh Slater

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was all about getting this camera so I ordered this for her. The first time using it we had issue's actually getting it to print the pictures and it wasn't turning over like it should. The pictures really don't turn out the best. The flash doesn't help any, just makes the pictures worse. Definitely don't see what all the fuss was for this camera and regret spending my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Childhood Hype-Never-Faded
customer_reviews.text: LIKE - I love the bright color, the texture of the camera, the oldies looking picture to capture a moment in time. It is very easy to use after a couple of practices. DISLIKE - I can't tell how much battery life there is, so bring spare batteries with you. I don't like the bulkiness, because I have to bring a bag just to hold it. USAGE - I use it for my vacation, day-to-day, or special event to practice capturing memories. Because the film is so expensive if you like to take alot of pictures, so it's a capture and can't go back to recapture type of ordeal.
customer_reviews.author: AnhAnh

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again. Love my Instax.
customer_reviews.text: I love my blue Instax. Can take great photos and I just use washi tape and they go into my daily calendar or my scrap book or I give a copy to a friend. They aren’t your large professional photos but they are great and fun and it’s easy to use. It literally tells you what the best setting you should set it on and if you forget it’s literally your fault. (I have and the photo came out too dark.) Worth the money and I would buy it again. My Instax captured so many good times through this last Summer. I’d buy it again. You won’t regret it
customer_reviews.author: B&H

customer_reviews.title: Cute Camera
customer_reviews.text: If you have ever had a polaroid, this will make you happy and bring back the feels! The pictures are mini, sometimes I like that but sometimes I miss the big square pictures of the 80s! This camera is very easy to use, I actually gave it to my 7 year old for Christmas and he loves it! Pictures are pretty clear, though sometimes darker so you need brighter lighting. The film is a bit expensive for only 10-20 pictures in the box, but if you are a fan of polaroids, this is the "it" camera!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: one worked and one didn't
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one for a gift, and got one as a gift. The one I was given worked great and I've been using it often and loving it. However, the one I gave as a gift did not work, the first picture came out great, but then the others came out black and fuzzy, it wasn't the film, because we tried multiple packs, so it must have ben the camera, I think we just weren't lucky and bought one of the busted ones. I am not saying they are always this way, but tis hard to order one fo you're not sure wether you're wasting your money or not.
customer_reviews.author: Orixa

customer_reviews.title: Badly broken
customer_reviews.text: oh my god it was so broken. Really disappointing opened it up there was rattling in the box pieces are off I pressed the button to open the camera all of the lights for the home and outdoor settings went red and then spit out all the film and started cutting the film off halfway because it got stuck. Did not press the picture button and all the film came out blurry because the camera was broken. DO. NOT. BUY. USED. Nobody returns one of these cameras unless there is something very wrong and Amazon does not check if it works.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Poor design for kids
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to give this to my kids (8 & 6). Unfortunately, half of the pictures in the film came out black, because their fingers were over the flash or the lens. They put the button to take pictures on the front of the camera, making it super hard for kids especially to press it without getting their other fingers in the way of the flash or lens.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Blake

customer_reviews.title: Worked on the first day then pictures came out all black.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my girlfriend for her birthday. She took several photos that came out okay the very first day out of the box. The next time she tried to use it we were unable to take any pictures and they all just came out black. We tried replacing the film and nothing. Not sure what happened but seems like the camera doesn’t last. I’m going to try to contact support to see if they can help us fix it or replace it. Will update this post
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Macias

customer_reviews.title: I’m so glad I tried them before Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: These may work better outside in the sunlight. But even in bright light inside the images were not recognizable. It was a great idea for young ones who enjoy instant gratification. Unfortunately it just didn’t work. Thankfully Amazon was very willing to accept the returns. I’m still waiting for the refund. I’ll update as to whether it happens or not.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Mary

customer_reviews.title: Instructions did not match product.
customer_reviews.text: The yellow light indicating flash charged never activated. Following chat instructions I was able to take 2 pictures but the quality was unacceptable. I set up an appointment for 12/3/18 for the chat person to call me but the call was never received the purpose of which was to walk me through taking quality pictures. I cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Deranian

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to take pics.
customer_reviews.text: I like the cute size, color choices of the cameras, and it’s a fun way to connect with people. There’s a quick learning curve to get the picture quality right. Let the camera pick the lighting or else the pics will be blurred, dark, faded or too bright.
customer_reviews.author: MarigoldLilyRosemary

customer_reviews.title: Great Color, Super Fun, Vintage Snapshots
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was so excited to receive this camera for Christmas. Definitely reminds me of the polaroids I used to snap as a kid, though these are a bit smaller. The film has a real vintage feel and it’s so cool to watch it develop. I helped her take a couple photos so she could get used to it and we ended up with some cute and fun family photos. The one down side is that the film only comes in packages of 10 (though there are some multi packs) so you only get 10 shots before you have to change it. Overall, well worth the price I paid. In fact, I may buy one for me! Would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Leatherman

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun Camera for a Cheap Price
customer_reviews.text: Random Christmas gift for my wife. She really liked it. She goes to a big music festival every summer and is planning on taking it and passing out the pictures she takes. Fun to have the instant photo experience to put a photo right into the little photo album I purchased for her. Super simple to use. Seems very durable. Hasn’t been dropped. Yet. Takes good quality pictures. There’s a lighting setting that’s nice. Kids love it. My 9 year old daughter has taken more pictures than my wife with it. And handing a kid the instant photo afterwards and watching their faces as it develops.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Doles

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s not tampered or used when you open it
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure amazon sent me a USED ONE!!! I got this things in 2019 and it has rarely worked!!! I tried literally to do everything there is but the pictures only develop like 1/20 of the time. As in sometimes I randomly get a developed picture. I have literally got through 4+ packages of film and this thing is so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Emma T.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, but very and overly expensive
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and fun toy for kids or adults that never grew up! The controls are extremely intuitive, the device looks very cute. It's not really a serious camera at all, because the pictures are microscopically tiny, and the image quality is complete and utter crap (low resolution, bad color reproduction, bad light sensitivity, e.t.c). It's a nice toy otherwise. The only and major complaint is the film cost. Each shot costs you 50-70 cents.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Pie

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE BEST QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: the picture comes out a little dark if u take pictures indoor but too bright if u take it under daylight. also if u r not ready and press the button by accident then that means a photo paper is wasted, theres no take two. anyway this might be good just for fun if u dont expect high quality pictures. i regret getting this. my neighbor brought a photo printing machine instead and it works so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny q yan chen

customer_reviews.title: I love my Polaroid Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love my Polaroid Camera. I take so many pictures on a daily basis, but I was never able to print them out. So having something to print them automatically is so cool. It’s nice to pin up memories on my wall. This makes a great gift for kids too!
customer_reviews.author: Okaybutdogs

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS UNLESS YOU WANT TO WASTE FILM
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to finally buy my own polaroid camera but to my annoyed disappointment, this camera is absolutely useless. I took several photos and properly handled them for the correct development, but this camera must be defective because out of now 16 photos (1&1/2 10 count film packs) only 3 photos turned out even slightly passable. I'm returning this thing asap because I want my money back if this thing is gonna be this useless! Terrible product! I'll buy it for full price at my local Best Buy, but screw this terrible camera!
customer_reviews.author: Emmett

customer_reviews.title: Relive the 70's all over again with this great little camera that takes nice little wallet pictures
customer_reviews.text: The plain facts: Seriously, it's a great little camera that takes good pictures. It's not perfect and certainly won't take pictures like a digital camera in clarity but it does replicate the older cameras exactly with a small wallet size picture. It reminds me of the old Polaroid pictures exactly in clarity but it's a small wallet size picture not the bigger one it would normally be. Definitely worth having for fun and a change from the norm. Probably a great gift for a younger kid too to take priceless pictures of friends in life or an animal they love.
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: Could be garbage, could be bad film?
customer_reviews.text: It only developed 4 out of 20 pictures. Quality is super garbage. I don’t know if we’ll return or keep. I’ll try buying film from some place other than target and see if maybe we got a bad batch of film.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and over ratted
customer_reviews.text: My wife got two of these for our two daughters (7 and 9). They were clearly super excited for getting something they can play with, but the quality of the pictures this thing produces is just horrible. Honestly, some people can draw with better resolution than the pictures coming out of these cameras. On top of that, the film is super expensive which makes this a pretty bad deal. If you get 25% decent photos, you are still paying about $5 for a tiny pictures that you can't really use for anything besides a keychain. What a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: momi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Despite reading the instructions carefully before using the first time, the film won’t develop. Too late to return as I shopped early. Very disappointing and would not buy again. 5/6 pics taken so far (Christmas morning) are black. This was the big Santa item and I have a sad kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my girlfriend. Every photo came out completely black. Used new film packs. I’m a photographer so I searched all kinds of googles for advanced info and came up with no answers. Defective. Second defective unit we’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: michael diggs

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This Polaroid was given as a white elephant at our family xmas party. Strange, I know!! This thing is awesome!! Back in the good old days these were like the bomb.com and now they are bringing them back! About time. Although some of the instructions on how to actually use the camera are a bit confusing and there are simply too many buttons overall, like lighting settings (even a selfie mirror in the front), this thing produces the coolest photos in about 2 minutes and it's awesome. I would suggest getting additional film!
customer_reviews.author: Jibs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a Christmas gift and it was awesome. It's a great faded pink color. The quality/brightness of the picture is hard to predict at times, but overall I enjoy this so much! One of my friends took a picture with it and the picture came out dark and I did the same picture and it was perfect. Not sure if the picture was exposed to much before it developed, but thats my only complaint. Its not going to be a perfect digital quality, but it gives your picture an old fashion style. It also comes with batteries! I would watch a youtube video after you get it to figure out how it works though.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: If you like huge disappointments and wasting money this is the camera for you!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this camera zero stars I would. Purchased for a child for Christmas, bought multi pack of film as well . Loaded film properly, pictures all came out black. Figured it was somehow user error. Switched to fresh battery and opened yet another pack of film and all pictures are black again. This film is not cheap and I am now out 2 of the five purchased. I requested a replacement, if this one is a lemon as well I’m returning completely and moving on. Don’t waste your time and money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is just sad. For $60, I expected more. Also the film is crazy expensive, so unless you have a ton of money, your child is going to be disappointed, for she/he will go through a pack of film in under an hour. Also, the pictures are really, really small. Combined with the poor quality, and you'll wonder why you bothered to buy the darn thing. Oh, that's right . . . because your child wanted one.
customer_reviews.author: James Williams, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product - Fujifilm Support Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a birthday present for my daughter. We went through two packs of film ($20 worth) and discovered that only the first two prints were working, and the rest came out blurry and dark, no matter the lighting condition. I contacted Fujifilm support and they agreed that it was a defective camera, and that I could send it back but would need to pay for shipping and wait 3-4 weeks for a replacement. Completely unacceptable, especially since I'm already out for the wasted film! I will get my refund from Amazon and look for another instant camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Garrett

customer_reviews.title: BAD CAMERA - Develops Black
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought the black prints were due to expired or damaged film. Until, I tried the same film in 2 different polaroids. I purchased the Instax mini 9 - I went through the first pack of 10 film and tried every single setting (indoor, outdoor, cloudy, dark room, sunlight, flash, etc.) in which every print came out black. I switched the film over to my friends Instax mini 26 - the first print came out perfect. I can not seem to solve the issue, therefore I assume fault is within the manufacturing of this product. I will be requesting a product refund.
customer_reviews.author: Emma VanZante

customer_reviews.title: Nice and as expected
customer_reviews.text: it came as described. I purchased film from target and picked it up myself because some reviews of instax film purchased online have indicated they are expired or damaged. The camera works as expected. I bought it to use at our wedding but that has been postponed, so we've only taken a few test pictures so far and they look like polaroid type pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ogopogo

customer_reviews.title: Love that this is cheaper than if I were to ...
customer_reviews.text: Love that this is cheaper than if I were to buy it in store. It literally comes the same way it would if you were to buy it from Best Buy or FYE or any other store that has them. I am in love with it already!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Fujifilm Instax 9 in January and had 1 decent roll, 1 all black on a Europe trip. Decided to just buy a new camera to replace it. This new one doesn't even print ANY film correctly. Everything is black. Huge waste of money and now I have to deal with Fujifilm's customer service to see if I can either replace the camera (yet again) or its the film's problem. Buy the Instax 8 the 9 is a piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L.

customer_reviews.title: DOESN’T WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got this for Christmas, opened it this morning. We filled the camera with film and she started taking pictures. All, except 1 came out black/blank. VERY DISAPPOINTED for the $$ paid!
customer_reviews.author: Spirito

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my Fujifilm Instax camera!!! No complaints. Easy to use and picture quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Best Intro Option for Instant Photographers
customer_reviews.text: Short and Sweet: Best intro option Photo is smaller than old standard of instant photography Need plenty of light for quality photo Point and shoot, no additional modes Has selfie mirror...i guess that's useful... Conclusion: Best for the casual user who cares more about the memory than the quality of the picture. If you're looking for a gift for a college student then I wouldn't go any further than this.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money unless you are outside or you have spotlights in your house
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas. It was easy to put the film in. The camera is supposed to automatically adjust (or you can manually adjust) for inside, outside, etc. The pictures she took inside were either completely black or you could barely see a face. If you took a picture right under the light it was better. I feel like I wasted my money on this camera. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Celena Miller

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: The lime green color is very very pretty and cute. The camera works well.
customer_reviews.author: Sponge Cake

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive to use. Very poor quality of pictures.
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY THIS PRODUCT! We regret the purchase of this camera. We bought a pink one for our granddaughter and a blue one for our grandson, but the quality of the pictures taken is absolutely worthless. Not a single picture has some kind of quality. It's the old fashioned Polaroid system, very expensive to use per photo too. I wish we bought something else instead. It's a waste of money on all fronts.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Boonstoppel

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use but lots of poor prints
customer_reviews.text: This is really fun, especially for a group of people (I ordered 3 for a business event), more than half of the prints weren't good and a third of them were almost totally black. Unless your lighting situation is perfect - e.g. outdoors or great indoor lighting - you'll waste half of the film and those cartridges aren't cheap. If I buy something similar for personal use, I'd go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: AnneNYC

customer_reviews.title: cute color, fun way to get kids outdoors exploring and taking pictures
customer_reviews.text: takes awhile to figure out how to get a decent picture. Once you get your settings right, it's ok. Not the best pictures, but that is to be expected. Fun toy for my daughter to get her outside and taking pictures. Buying film on amazon in bulk has helped keep the ongoing cost down a little. Still expensive, but not as much as it would be buying from local stores.
customer_reviews.author: C. Birth

customer_reviews.title: Fun with a learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This is super fun! My daughter loves having an instant hard copy of her photos. It took her a minute to get used to what you get is what you get, no prescreening shot before you print them out. It has made her more thoughtful in her photography. There is a learning curve that can be expensive if you are not careful as each photo costs approximately 50 cents depending on if you buy film in bulk or not. Watch some YouTube videos for tips and tricks to getting good photos.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crane

customer_reviews.title: Wasted half a roll, but maybe working now.
customer_reviews.text: first picture looked really dark but subject was visible. next 4 pictures were totally dark. Since film is $1/picture, who wants to waste money on $1 per experiments. Disappointing but after removing the film (which automatically ruins the next picture) and reinserting , it started to work, but I am not comfortable with the way the door is closing and might have to return this one. I will waste one more roll ($10) and then give an update
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Snob

customer_reviews.title: Cute camera and fun for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nieces Christmas gifts. They were a huge hit!! Buy extra film, you’ll need it but it’s expensive. The picture quality was ok, nothing special but very “poloroid”esq. and the film does take a bit longer than expected to process. If you’re looking for a camera to take a million picture on a vacation this isn’t it, but it’s still fun and creates fun memories.
customer_reviews.author: Kpres18

customer_reviews.title: The camera is nice, but I had a lot of problems
customer_reviews.text: My camera had the "on" button broken with just 2 weeks of use. After I had it repaired in a Fujifilm authorized customer service center, the "super-sun" adjustment stopped working. Now, the pictures I take with this dial adjustment come out totally white. I'm still waiting for a solution to my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but expensive for the gimmick
customer_reviews.text: The camera is made entirely of plastic and it's pretty good for what it is. However, if you consider how much the film costs it starts getting pretty expensive. You'll either spend a lot of money if you love taking pictures or conserve your film for the right moment, which defeats it's purpose of being a camera to play with. If you're going to spend 100+ dollars on film then you might as well get a lower end digital camera, but i expect most of the people buying these will only use them to show off to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: simply a faulty product
customer_reviews.text: I expect a camera/film professional would know where the exposure problem lies, I don't. The camera will take one good picture, always following the lighting instructions precisely. The subsequent picture (same spot, same lighting, same everything) will show a white light ball in the middle of the picture, while everything else is almost black. All following pictures are just black. Did it with two consecutive camera and film orders. Same thing.
customer_reviews.author: ec

customer_reviews.title: Stops working within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my daughter's Christmas gift. She loved it, and it worked well for about 6 months, then it just stopped working. All the lights around the lens came on and stayed on, it wouldn't take pictures, and we actually couldn't turn the camera off unless we removed the batteries.(I've read that many customers have had this same exact issue). I regret not buying an extended warranty, because apparently the manufacturer only covers it for 90 days. Yes, I should have checked this before purchasing, but still....very under-handed! Most products are covered for one year. BUYER BEWARE! The camera is now worthless. I might as well have thrown our money in the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: 7869s

customer_reviews.title: Cute and fun, don't expect super high quality pics!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because I love Polaroid pictures, I like that you can take it pretty much anywhere and it's very easy to use. However, the quality of the pictures aren't great, don't expect to have very bright pictures. If you're out in the sun or in bright lighting they'll look great. The camera has flash but it doesn't help much in darker scenarios, I tried taking pictures of my kiddo around sunset time and they were dark. The film can be pricy so I don't like wasting them. Other than that, its super cute and fun to have for special occasions!
customer_reviews.author: Geddi

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Point and shoot, easy. However over 1/2 of the photos come out black. No our finger was not in the way, we took great care to open the film and put in the camera in a dark place. Nothing helped and consistently 4-5 pictures came out black not the same # in pack either. Very frustrating and poor quality for expensive instant camera and expensive film.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Schafer

customer_reviews.title: Instant gratification
customer_reviews.text: This camera gives you the immediate gratification of having a picture to give to someone. I travel to Haiti and the children freq ask for me to take their "foto". I carry a Canon 35mm Mark IV which takes a great pic and I can show the child their pic. Hence the reason for the 4 star rating for picture quality. But the Fuji Instamax allows me to not only take their "foto" but to also hand it to them. That gives them so much excitement and I get pure joy out of doing this for them. I just know I need to take a lot more film on my next trip!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instamax camera
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with this product. Each picture that we have taken had a bright white area in the picture . We tried two different packs of film .. and it is the same thing. I bought as a gift for my daughter to take to college... ☹️. We've had several people look at the camera and we did everything correctly..so it must be a malfunction with the flash on the camera. I was very upset over this and will be returning it asap.
customer_reviews.author: TERESA B.

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE RIGHT COLOR.
customer_reviews.text: This is clearly NOT lime green. I will be returning and sadly I don’t trust to reorder the lime green and actually get the color my daughter wants. It’s the only thing she asked for Christmas. I can’t keep buying and returning hoping we get the right thing for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Fun photo nostalgia awaits at every turn
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. Fun photo nostalgia awaits at every turn! Note for when you're testing it out for the first time: The light doesn't change when you adjust the lens setting. The light changes AUTOMATICALLY to the position that is recommended you change the lens to. It's confusing at first. Even the instructions are incredibly vague as to how it's supposed to work. I had to Google troubleshooting before I read the explanation by another user. Sure enough, if you walk through your house, or outside, you can see the light moving around as you go into different levels of lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Scott A

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So worth the buy! My sister purchased this for my 30th birthday kickback & everyone loved it!!! The quality definitely depends on you surrounding/lighting!! So we realized we needed light very quickly whenever we took pics inside but outside during daylight the quality is perfect!! Also I didn't expect the pictures to be that small but still it doesn't take away from the awesomeness of this little camera! ***Taking a star away because one of the film's it came with only took 3pics outta the 10, it just wouldn't do anything so thankfully I had purchased extra film so I changed the roll n it worked just fine! But I still lost out on 7pics lol
customer_reviews.author: Wooky 🌻

product_meta.title: Fujifilm Instax Mini 9 Instant Camera, Cobalt Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Cobalt Blue| Style:BaseThe new, Instax Mini 9 camera retains the ease of use and attractive design elements of the extremely popular Instax Mini 8 while adding five new exciting colors and a couple of new features. The new colors are: Flamingo Pink, Ice Blue, Lime Green, Cobalt Blue and Smokey White. The new, Instax Mini 9 features a selfie mirror for the perfect selfie photo every time. Close up macro photos are now easier thanks to the included close-up lens adapter which allows you to focus on subjects as close as 35-50cm. The Instax Mini 9 retains all of the other great features found in the Mini 8 including: Automatic exposure measurement. The camera signals the recommended aperture setting with a flashing LED light and the user can manually adjust the dial to the recommended setting. This helps the user capture the perfect photo every time. The High-Key mode enables consumers to take brighter pictures with a soft look -perfect for portraits.
feature_bullets: New selfie mirror; Auto power off time: 5 min
New macro lens adapter for close ups 35 centimeter to 50 centimeter; Shutter speed: 1 per 60 sec
Automatic exposure measurement; The camera signals the recommended aperture setting with a flashing LED; This helps capture the perfect photo every time
High Key mode takes brighter pictures with a soft look perfect for portraits
2 AA batteries, picture size: 2.44 x 1.81 inch flash: Constant firing flash (automatic light adjustment) Recycle time: 0.2 sec to 6 sec (when using new batteries)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars14,442 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
